screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Google Play Store page for the app "Google Pay: Save, Pay, Manage" by Google LLC. The app has a 4.1-star rating with over 8 million reviews and has been downloaded over 500 million times. It is rated for everyone. The installation button is visible, and the app's main features such as paying friends, earning rewards, and safely sending money are highlighted. Below the app details, there are recommendations for other apps that users might also like, such as "Fasting - Intermittent Fasting" and "Cash App". There's also a section for "Similar apps" at the bottom.
action_think: The current screen is the Google Play Store page for the 'Google Pay' app, which is not relevant to the user's request. The user has requested to open the Pinterest app, and if it is not installed, to install it, go to login, and select 'forgot password'. I will need to navigate back to the main screen of the Play Store or to the home screen and then search for 'Pinterest' in the Google Play Store. From there, if the app is not installed, the 'Install' button will need to be pressed. If the app is already installed, it can be opened directly, and then I can proceed to the login screen to select 'forgot password'. The current screen has a back arrow at the top left corner, which I can use to navigate back to the main screen of the Google Play Store to begin searching for Pinterest.
action_plan: Press the back arrow at the top left corner of the screen to go back to the main Play Store screen.
Use the search bar at the top of the screen to search for the 'Pinterest' app.
If 'Pinterest' is not installed, press the 'Install' button. If it is installed, open the app.
Navigate to the login screen of the Pinterest app.
Select 'Forgot password' on the login screen.
action_desc: Click on the back arrow icon located at the top and left.
action_result: By clicking on the "Back" button at the top-left corner of the screen, I have navigated back from the Google Pay app page to the main page of the Google Play Store. This action has taken us away from the specific app page of Google Pay but has not directly progressed towards the completion of the user request to open the Pinterest app, go to login, and select "forgot password." To complete the user request, I will need to search for the Pinterest app in the Google Play Store, install it if it's not already installed, open it, navigate to the login page, and then select "forgot password."
